data.title: Space inserted before "!" in .ts file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type this code:

```
const myVar = alert()!;
```
2. You'll see that when you type the ";", an space is introduced before the "!".

The "Format" command also leads to the same result.

data.title: ITerminalInstance.onDisposed can fire multiple times for a single instance
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:

- create a terminal with a running process 
- dispose the terminal by pressing the garbage bin button

Observe:

you get ITerminalInstance.onDisposed() but no ITerminalInstance.onExit(). Since the process exists as well I would expect to first receive the onExit and then the onDisposed event.

data.title: Background color in settings number of results not needed IMHO
data.body:
Did you try this without the background color?
I do not see the need for the background color as this is already quite seperated from the input as it is on the other end of a huge input field.
Also we do not use background color like this anywhere else in our input boxes

![screen shot 2017-01-23 at 11 34 40](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/22200621/16bf2b8e-e160-11e6-8f81-d9ac997a2b29.png)

data.title: Style misalingment between settings tabs and panel tabs
data.body:
We should use the same design for our tabs in settings and in the panel. Namely USER SETTINGS and WORKSPACE SETTINGS need to have the same design as the PROBLEMS, OUTPUT... in the panel

Notice that in the panel the unfocused titles color is not so strong and the font used is smaller.

![screen shot 2017-01-23 at 11 31 57](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/22200512/b2444946-e15f-11e6-91f0-9b85277095ed.png)

data.title: Style misalignment between search widget input box and settings input box
data.body:
Why do we have the lense icon in the settings search, while this icon is nowhere else present in our UI? This is not aligning well with our search viewlet input. This icon should be removed as we nowhere else use it in our UI and the placeholder text makes it clear to the user what is going on.

![screen shot 2017-01-23 at 11 29 18](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/22200393/3c080f9c-e15f-11e6-8c83-be2220636950.png)

data.title: Style misalignment between settings search no results and find widget
data.body:
Notice how the find widget uses a discrete red color in the text, not the background red which looks too ugly and prominent imho
Setting should use the same style which we already have in find widget

Also why is Settings capital case and matched lower case? Maybe we should just say 'No Results'

![screen shot 2017-01-23 at 11 27 09](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/22200346/056aec84-e15f-11e6-9b1b-07241686551a.png)

data.title: Double edit action in settings
data.body:
1. Open settings, have a cursor on some line
2. Move the mouse over some other lines
3. Notice there are two edit action appearing in the margin

Why do we show the edit action in the margin on the line where the cursor is?
I thought this edit action is asociated with user clicking on it, thus it should follow the mouse.

As an unrelated bug you can also see that glyphMargin: false looks bad with your edit actions, but I already filled that

![screen shot 2017-01-23 at 11 24 32](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/22200264/ac1e8ffa-e15e-11e6-9a25-5b2c31f0ea44.png)

data.title: [folding][general] New option for Code Folding Indicator [+]/[-]
data.body:
Is it already possible to make the Folding Indicators stay visual and not only show them on hovering over the Space next to the Number or not?

If it is please tell me how/where.

If not why not i think this was requested multiple times.
I think this could be done with setting:

"editor.folding" 

just make it a triple select [false, hover, always] instead of just [true, false]

data.title: Customizable Explorer model
data.body:
Please allow customization of the Explorer (files & folders side bar) model to allow opening files from sources other than the plain file system/directory structure.

Examples include allowing to view/edit the contents of a ZIP file containing the project files or viewing/editing code packaged in proprietary binary formats like Oracle's FMB or PLL files.

data.title: problems in opened files setting
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.1 (ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281, 2016-12-19T14:49:23.350Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.5|
|php-intellisense|felixfbecker|0.0.12|
|code-runner|formulahendry|0.6.6|
|beautify|HookyQR|0.7.3|
|vs-color-picker|lihui|0.3.2|
|vscode-hexdump|slevesque|1.1.4|
|gitblame|waderyan|1.3.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. install php-intellisense extension
2. open workspace with PHP files
3. open any PHP file

Expected: Problems panel has problems of only opened files

Actual: Problems panel has problems of total workspace.

Can you add setting to scan on problems only opened files? I have too large workspace with many "prev-" temporary files. I don't need to see errors from temporary files. And I don't need to scan all files, because it take CPU resources.

thank you.

P.S. I write this report to you, because without "php-intellisense" I see in problems panel message: "No problems have been detected in the workspace so far". => This is VSCode ask "php-intellisense" to scan total workspace, if I correct.

data.title: The replace string should support additional escape char sequences

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Today it supports:
* `\t` for a tab character
* `\n` for a line break (depending on the file's EOL settings)

Consider supporting more from the following table:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5047891/22177186/687deb1a-e019-11e6-96b4-4412e5ecca48.png)

data.title: #9003 Provide temporary option to disable the built-in PHP completion provider
data.body:
This option enables extension authors providing PHP support to prevent needless duplication in the completions list. We can remove it when we extract this functionality to a separate extension.

close #9003

data.title: Editors are identified case-sensitively on case-insensitive file systems leading to multiple editors for the same underlying file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

On Windows:
1. Open the same file twice via the command line but using different case, ie, `code foo` and `code FOO`.
2. There will be two editors open despite being backed by the same underlying file.

This is not limited to just the command line API, ie, a debugger can open up a file with a different case than what is present on the file-system which ends up causing breakpoints to not display properly.

data.title: Search & Replace text with blank string does not work
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.9.0 - insider
- OS Version: macOS Sierra Version 10.12.2

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Select a text to replace with blank string (zero length string).
2. Press cmd-opt-F to open search-replace box.
3. Ensure that the selected text is now in the first textbox of search-replace box.
4. Ensure nothing is typed in second textbox (Replace) of search-replace box.
5 Click on 'Replace' or 'Replace All' buttons (adjacent to replace textbox).

**Expected Result**: 
Occurrences of text on search box should get replaced by blank zero length string (regular normal behaviour in any rext editor).

**Actual Result**:
Nothing happens!

data.title: webpack command works in Terminal but doesn't work in task run.
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

webpack command works in Terminal but doesn't work in task run.

- VSCode Version:
- OS Version: windows server 2012

I run "node_modules\\.bin\\webpack.cmd" by task runner, I get the result:

```
running command> node_modules\.bin\webpack.cmd 
Hash: f0b84287dadbc64086ce
Version: webpack 1.14.0
Time: 90ms
           Asset       Size  Chunks             Chunk Names
         main.js    2.02 kB          [emitted]  
      index.html  495 bytes          [emitted]  
    package.json  456 bytes          [emitted]  
    lib/react.js     128 kB          [emitted]  
lib/react-dom.js     620 kB          [emitted]  
   [0] ./src/renderer.js 0 bytes [built] [failed]
WARNING in NODE_ENV environment variable is undefined.
ERROR in ./src/renderer.js
Module parse failed: c:\x\electron_project\electron-react-webpack-test\src\renderer.js Unexpected token (48:12)
```
I run "node_modules\\.bin\\webpack.cmd" by Terminal in vscode, 

```
C:\x\electron_project\electron-react-webpack-test>node_modules\\.bin\\webp
ack.cmd
Hash: de6c1c06fa2413d3a39d
Version: webpack 1.14.0

Time: 1327ms
           Asset       Size  Chunks             Chunk Names
     renderer.js     172 kB       0  [emitted]  renderer
    renderer.map     205 kB       0  [emitted]  renderer
         main.js    2.02 kB          [emitted]
      index.html  495 bytes          [emitted]
    package.json  456 bytes          [emitted]
    lib/react.js     128 kB          [emitted]
lib/react-dom.js     620 kB          [emitted]
    + 62 hidden modules

WARNING in NODE_ENV environment variable is undefined.
```

Steps to Reproduce:

I prepare my code and config in github, just clone it.

1. git clone https://github.com/rickyteng/electron-react-webpack-test.git
2. npm install
3. open vscode
4. press F1, select "Tasks : run task", then "node_modules\\.bin\\webpack.cmd"

note: all modules installed locally.

data.title: win10 alt + key for menu bar not working when scroll lock is on

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: win 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a vscode window

**2. toggle scroll lock on**
3. press alt then any other menu bar shortcut key to toggle a menu but failed

3. press alt + (any menu bar shortcut key) the menu won't show

won't reproduce on fedora os because the scroll lock seems to be disabled ^_^

I don't think it is a big problem, I don't use scroll lock at all, I just think it's abnormal

data.title: Cannot find module 'jsdom'
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:1.8.1
- OS Version:win10

Hi, when I writing an extension for vsCode, I got a problem as followed.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17958546/22188664/5a9bc12c-e152-11e6-9e9b-5bcb049816b3.png)
As you can see, When I want to import a package, I got an error "Cannot find module 'jsdom' ". But I had written it in the 'package.json' like this

BTW, I have tried the method mentioned( extension *typescript-hero*) in this [issue](https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript/issues/10346), but it doesn't work for me

data.title: createTextEditorDecorationType doesn't display text in single quotes
data.body:
Version 1.8.1
Commit ee428b0eead68bf0fb99ab5fdc4439be227b6281
Date 2016-12-19T14:41:20.664Z
Shell 1.4.6
Renderer 53.0.2785.143
Node 6.5.0

When I add a decoration like this:

```javascript
                  const decoration = vscode.window.createTextEditorDecorationType({
                    isWholeLine: true,
                    backgroundColor: `rgba(255,0,0, 0.5)`,
                    color: 'white',
                    after: {
                      contentText: `'this is not visible'`,
                      color: 'rgba(1, 1, 1, 1.0)'

                  window.activeTextEditor.setDecorations(decoration, [range])
```

the textContent `'this is not visible'` is not visible.

Also when I put in just `'` it displays some css.

data.title: configuration.update doesn't do anything on malformed json

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Example user settings:
```json
{
  "editor.renderWhitespace": "all",
}
```
It does get treated by vscode correctly (correctly parsed and used). However when calling
```ts
getConfiguration("test").update("foo", "bar", true);
```
now it won't do anything unless I remove that comma at the end of the line.

People who never edited the settings manually complained about my extension not correctly working because the config doesn't update.

data.title: Git Bash integrated terminal odd behaviour
data.body:
A few integrated terminal commands using Git Bash have some odd behavior right off the bat with this newest release of Insider.

The `clear` command results in:
```
$ clear
'bash.exe': unknown terminal type.
```

`vim` results in:
```
$ vim Vagrantfile
E437: terminal capability "cm" required
Press ENTER or type command to continue
```
Then after pressing enter, vim launches but all the spacing is messed up.

Also, backspace just adds spaces now.  And it seems like the up/down keys just keep appending previous commands rather than cycling through them.

Let me know if there is any testing needed on my end.

- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.9.0-insider (ee9d91c05fa571de56c41383cceee30b05b0a2f6, 2017-01-20T15:08:19.064Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14986
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-instant-markdown|dbankier|0.2.1|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.6|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.9.3|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.11|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.0.1|
|vim|vscodevim|0.4.11|
|vscode-todo-highlight|wayou|0.3.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Set C:\\Program Files\\Git\\bin\\bash.exe as integrated windows terminal
2.  Launch integrated terminal
3.  Type commands to view odd behaviour

data.title: [Request] Make findFiles "include", "exclude" an array of strings
data.body:
Curently `findFiles` only accepts `string` as `include` and `exclude`.
There are cases where we need to either include or exclude more than one pattern.

In my case, I need to do a search for `**/package.json` but want to exclude `node_modules`, `bin`, `out`, `build`, `dist`, etc folders from the search.

data.title: macOS: Cmd+A does not work in menu help input field

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.2 Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Make sure you have an editor open with your most valuable code.
2. Click on the Help menu item in the menu bar.
3. Start typing to search the menus. For example, type: "occur"
4. Realize you wanted to search for something else... so hit CMD+A, DELETE.
5. ....where did my code go?

Note, this does not happen in Xcode. When you hit CMD+A, the Help menu stays open.

In VSCode, CMD+A closes the Help menu and then selects all of your current editor's contents.

data.title: Add 'Extension Pack' as a supported category
Triggering random filechanges for ".gitignore" file
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Win 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run chokidar file watcher to monitor all file changes in current directory (use this [repro](https://github.com/laggingreflex/chokidar-vscode-test))
2. Have a `.gitignore` file
3. Open VSCode in current dir
4. Make changes to any file, other than `.gitignore`
5. chokidar randomly logs file changes for `.gitignore` file

PS: It's not related to `chokidar` as I've tried with other editors and VSCode is the only one that this happens in. Even with `--disable-extensions`

data.title: split panel
data.body: Could u add option to have 2 panels side by side. I usually switch between problem and terminal. I would be great if u could have them side by side

data.title: Add .npmignore as a known file type
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

In Windows Explorer, when you choose to always open `.npmignore` files with VS Code, they do not get the code file icon like `.gitignore` does, but just the generic VS Code app icon. Would be nice to add this as a known file type, so those files also get the correct icon.

Meanwhile, here's a registry hack to fix it:
```
Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00

[HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\VSCode.npmignore]
@="NPM Ignore Source File"
"AlwaysShowExt"=""

[HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\VSCode.npmignore\DefaultIcon]
@="C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Microsoft VS Code\\resources\\app\\resources\\win32\\code_file.ico"

[HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\VSCode.npmignore\shell]

[HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\VSCode.npmignore\shell\open]

[HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\VSCode.npmignore\shell\open\command]
@="\"C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Microsoft VS Code\\Code.exe\" \"%1\""

[HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\.npmignore]

[HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\.npmignore\OpenWithProgids]
"VSCode.npmignore"=""
```

data.title: Trimming trailing spaces based on file type
data.body:
Hi there,

I love auto trimming trailing spaces but I had to turn it off because in certain file types it breaks the syntax. For instance Jade/Pug.
It would be great if I could specify where the trimming would be disabled. Something like:

```json
files.trimTrailingWhitespaceExclude: [
    ".jade",
    ".pug",
]
```

Just simple extension recognition would do the job.

Thank you in advance.
